head.title: Statement on 'Ugly Tree' Gave the Wrong Impression

hedline.hl1: Statement on 'Ugly Tree' Gave the Wrong Impression

block.p: Your article ''In Kingsbridge, a Sycamore Faces an Unwelcome Neighbor'' (Oct. 1), quotes me as saying ''What's all the fuss over a big ugly tree?''

This quote suggests the opposite of my actual intentions and efforts. I have been an advocate of saving the sycamore throughout the entire development process, having hired an arborist to make recommendations on preserving the tree during the construction period and thereafter. I have designed the building to include an indentation that will accommodate the tree's roots.

This quote suggests the opposite of my actual intentions and efforts. I have been an advocate of saving the sycamore throughout the entire development process, having hired an arborist to make recommendations on preserving the tree during the construction period and thereafter. I have designed the building to include an indentation that will accommodate the tree's roots.

According to the arborist, if his recommendations are followed, which I intend to do, the tree should survive nicely. Although the sycamore is not on my property and legally not my responsibility, I am committed to properly caring for it throughout the construction period and thereafter.
JOHN H. LESE Partner, 231 Sycamore Associates
